text:
They are drunk... They are brutal...

A young man clutches his father.  
“I feel choked... I can’t breathe!”  

---

Under a tree, he gasps for air.  
“Thank God, that was only a dream.”  

---

“Good God! Can I really do it?”  
He trembles, the weight of horror pressing down.  

---

“Why am I torturing myself?”  
“I could never bear to do it!”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** The protagonist is tormented by a horrifying dream that forces him to confront his inner turmoil and the possibility of committing a violent act he believes he cannot carry out.
